meanings.definition: To enclose in or as if in a shrine.
meanings.sent1: The precious artifact was inshrined in a glass case for all to see.
meanings.sent2: The ancient relic was inshrined in a beautiful temple.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to inshrine its favorite toy in a shoebox.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were inshrined in the walls of her childhood home.
meanings.sent5: The love for her family was inshrined in her heart forever.

meanings.sent1: She inshrined the old family recipe, passing it down through generations.
meanings.sent2: The community inshrined the tradition of planting a tree every spring.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly inshrined his lucky socks in a special drawer.
meanings.sent4: The values of honesty and kindness were inshrined in their upbringing.
meanings.sent5: The bond between the siblings was inshrined in their shared adventures.
